message.content:
<<<api>>>: Process.waitFor
<<<code>>>: try {
    Process pr = rt.exec("C:\\Users\\babesha.fm\\Desktop\\SUM.exe 10 5");
    int exitVal = pr.waitFor();
    InputStream inputStream = pr.getInputStream();
    BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(inputStream));
    String line;
    while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
        System.out.println(line);
    }
    System.out.println("Exited with error code " + exitVal);
} catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
} catch (InterruptedException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The `pr.waitFor()` method returns the exit value of the process, not the output of the process. To get the output of the process, you need to read from the `InputStream` of the process using a `BufferedReader`. In the code above, I added the necessary code to read the output of the process and print it.
